Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of the TRIFLO Heart Valve

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults with severe aortic stenosis eligible for valve replacement.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received the TRIFLO Heart Valve, while the control group received the On-X valve.

Objective.evidence: This trial assesses a novel tri-leaflet mechanical valve designed to minimize thrombogenicity without long-term anticoagulation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of major bleeding events at 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 8 participants were randomised: 6 to the TRIFLO group and 2 to the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: All participants were analysed per protocol.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The TRIFLO group showed no major bleeding events, while the control group also reported none.

Harms.evidence: The TRIFLO valve demonstrated favorable hemodynamics, with no thrombus formation or adverse events.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by Novostia, Switzerland.
